questions.question: Which one among the following is not a micronutrient for plants?
questions.solution: Micronutrients for plants include iron, manganese, zinc, copper, molybdenum, boron, and chlorine. Magnesium is a macronutrient.

questions.question: Halophytes are the plants that grow on which one among the following categories of soil?
questions.solution: Halophytes are salt-tolerant plants that grow in saline soils.

questions.question: Xylem in the plants are responsible for the transport of:
questions.solution: Xylem is the tissue in vascular plants that transports water and dissolved minerals from roots to other parts of the plant.

questions.question: Which one among the following hormones inhibits the growth activity in plants?
questions.solution: Abscisic acid is a plant hormone that inhibits growth and promotes dormancy.

questions.question: Which of the following biomolecules does starch belong to?
questions.solution: Starch is a carbohydrate, specifically a polysaccharide, that serves as an energy reserve in plants.

questions.question: Which one among the following is not a feature of Xerophytes?
questions.solution: Xerophytes are plants adapted to dry environments, typically having fewer stomata to reduce water loss.

questions.question: Which one among the following is not a part of the vascular bundle in plants?
questions.solution: The vascular bundle in plants consists of xylem, phloem, and cambium. Endodermis is not a part of the vascular bundle.

questions.question: In which one among the following mediums would the speed of sound be maximum?
questions.solution: The speed of sound is maximum in sea water due to its higher density compared to distilled water, drinking water, and methanol.

questions.question: Which organelle in animal cells can digest foreign materials?
questions.solution: Lysosomes contain digestive enzymes that break down foreign materials, waste products, and cellular debris.

questions.question: Photosynthesis that converts light energy into chemical energy by the plants involves the use of green pigments of leaves called chlorophyll. The only structure in a leaf that hosts chlorophyll is:
questions.solution: Chloroplasts are the organelles in plant cells that contain chlorophyll and conduct photosynthesis.

questions.question: In which of the following colloids is the dispersing medium a liquid?
questions.solution: Mist is a colloidal dispersion where tiny liquid droplets are dispersed in a gas (air).

questions.question: The two isotopes of elemental chlorine are:
questions.solution: Chlorine has two common isotopes, \(^{35}Cl\) and \(^{37}Cl\), both having 17 protons but different numbers of neutrons.

questions.question: Which one among the following metals is stored under oil?
questions.solution: Sodium is highly reactive with water and air, and therefore it is stored under oil to prevent it from reacting.

questions.question: Potassium nitrate is not used:
options: as a preservative of meat products
questions.correct_answer: as a preservative of meat products
questions.solution: Potassium nitrate is used in fertilizers, gunpowder, and medicine, but not as a meat preservative.

questions.question: The surface of the concrete structure of a new construction is covered with straw/gunny bags by wetting. This is done to:
options: prevent fast evaporation, until hydration has proceeded well
protect the concrete structure from contamination by dust particles
prevent the development of any fungus on the surface
give a smoother and cleaner surface over the cement structure
questions.correct_answer: prevent fast evaporation, until hydration has proceeded well
questions.solution: Keeping the surface wet prevents quick evaporation of water, which helps in proper hydration and curing of concrete.

questions.question: Which one among the following statements for the gases mentioned below is not correct?
options: Helium is a commonly used gas in electric bulbs.
Oxygen is used to burn fuel in rocket engines in spacecraft.
Nitrogen can be used in gaseous form to replace air in food packaging.
questions.correct_answer: Helium is a commonly used gas in electric bulbs.
questions.solution: Argon, not helium, is commonly used in electric bulbs to prevent the tungsten filament from oxidizing.

questions.question: Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the code given below the Lists:
questions.solution:
A. Bleaching powder - Calcium oxychloride (3)
B. Baking soda - Sodium bicarbonate (1)
C. Washing soda - Sodium carbonate, 10 water (2)
D. Plaster of Paris - Calcium sulphate, water 1/2 (4)

questions.question: Which one among the following statements is not true for glass?
options: Sodium silicate is known as water glass.
Glass is also called a super-cooled liquid.
Crystallinity develops on cooling of the molten mass of the glass.
Colored glasses can be made by adding different coloring materials.
questions.correct_answer: Crystallinity develops on cooling of the molten mass of the glass.
questions.solution: Glass is an amorphous solid; it does not develop crystallinity on cooling.

questions.question: Which one among the following is responsible for determining the chemical properties of an element?
questions.solution: The chemical properties of an element are primarily determined by its electrons, particularly the valence electrons.

questions.question: X-rays can be used to:
questions.solution: X-rays can be used to inspect welded joints and study the structure of crystals.

questions.question: Which one of the following heat transfers is an example of convection?
options: Heating of food in a microwave oven
Boiling water in a pot on a gas stove
Feeling the warmth in the sun
The warm air that circulates in a room due to an air conditioner
questions.correct_answer: Boiling water in a pot on a gas stove
questions.solution: Boiling water in a pot on a stove is an example of convection, where heat is transferred by the movement of liquid (water).

questions.question: Which one among the following waves carries the maximum energy per quantum?
questions.solution: X-rays have higher frequencies and therefore carry more energy per quantum compared to ultraviolet rays, radio waves, and visible light waves.
